meanings.definition: To look or gaze upward with a fixed stare.
meanings.sent1: She would upstare at the stars every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: The child would upstare at the tall tree in wonder.
meanings.sent3: As the cat tried to upstare at the bird, it comically fell off the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to upstare into the infinite sky above.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the moment when the character would upstare at the mysterious figure.

meanings.definition: A flight of stairs leading upward.
meanings.sent1: The old building had a narrow upstare that creaked with each step.
meanings.sent2: She carefully climbed the upstare to reach the top floor.
meanings.sent3: The upstare in the haunted house seemed to go on forever.
meanings.sent4: The upstare in the castle spiraled elegantly towards the tower.
meanings.sent5: The upstare in the library was lined with ancient books on each step.
